Question
========

According to the Wikipedia:

> [Algorithmic bias](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Algorithmic_bias) describes systematic and repeatable errors in a computer system that create unfair outcomes, such as privileging one arbitrary group of users over others. 

Which of the following statements are true:

Answerlist
----------
* Algorithms reflect the biases of their creators (both people and data).
* Algorithmic bias only occurs when the programmer explicitly and intentionally codes the algorithm to discriminate against certain kinds of people. 
* Algorithms are inherently unbiased---it's only the data that is biased. 
* Algorithms should never take variables like race into account in order to maintain neutrality. 
* Algorithms should always take variables like race into account because it is important.


Solution
========

Answerlist
----------
* True. 
* False. Biased data can lead to algorithmic bias.
* False. Algorithms reflect the biases of their creators. 
* False. Neutrality is a myth. 
* False. In many cases this would be problematic.
